thread.title: Adele teases new song on UK’s ‘X Factor’
thread.title_full: Adele teases new song on UK’s ‘X Factor’ - NY Daily News

author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: Adele teases new song on UK’s ‘X Factor’
text:
Well, it's about time.
British songwriter Adele has penned a new track about unrequited love and it's her first single in three years.
She teased the new tune, which is about missing an old flame, in a commercial that aired on Sunday night's UK's "X Factor."
Her last single "Sky Fall" was released in 2012.
The unnamed song is reportedly from her new album "25" out Nov. 20.
Rumor has it the album will feature collaborations with Pharrell Williams, Max Martin and One Republic's Ryan Tedder.
Adele won six Grammy awards for her last record "21", which was released in 2011.
Kevin Winter/Getty Images Singer Adele performs onstage during the 2013 Oscars. It sold 8.3 million copies in 2012 and 18.1 million in 2011, according to Billboard.
Following the success of “21” she took a five-year break from recording.
"I am f----ing off for four or five years. If I am constantly working, my relationships fail,” she told Vogue in 2012.
“So at least now I can have enough time to write a happy record. And be in love and be happy.”
The 27-year-old singer shares a three-year-old son Angelo with her boyfriend, Simon Konecki, a charity entrepreneur.
mhood@nydailynews.com
